en.title: DigiFact # 1 - Did you know...
en.content: The DigiByte blockchain launched in 2014. Thanks to its 15 second block time, it is the longest UTXO blockchain in existence with over $blocks_tot_mil million blocks. Bitcoin will take until the 22nd century to reach that many blocks.

zh.title: 数字事实 #1 - 你知道吗？
zh.content: DigiByte 区块链于2014年启动。由于其15秒的区块时间，它是现存最长的UTXO区块链，拥有超过$blocks_tot_mil百万个区块。比特币将需要到22世纪才能达到那么多区块。

ru.title: ДиджиФакт #1 - Знаете ли вы...
ru.content: Блокчейн DigiByte был запущен в 2014 году. Благодаря времени блока в 15 секунд, это самый длинный блокчейн UTXO в мире, насчитывающий более $blocks_tot_mil миллионов блоков. Биткоину понадобится до 22 века, чтобы достичь такого количества блоков.

es.title: DigiDato #1 - ¿Sabías que...
es.content: La cadena de bloques de DigiByte se lanzó en 2014. Gracias a su tiempo de bloque de 15 segundos, es la cadena de bloques UTXO más larga que existe con más de $blocks_tot_mil millones de bloques. Bitcoin tardará hasta el siglo 22 en alcanzar esa cantidad de bloques.

ko.title: 디지팩트 #1 - 혹시 알고 계셨나요...
ko.content: 디지바이트 블록체인은 2014년에 시작되었습니다. 15초 블록 시간 덕분에, $blocks_tot_mil백만 블록이 넘는 가장 긴 UTXO 블록체인으로, 비트코인은 그 많은 블록에 도달하는 데 22세기까지 걸릴 것입니다.

ja.title: デジファクト #1 - ご存知でしたか...
ja.content: デジバイトブロックチェーンは2014年に始まりました。15秒のブロック時間のおかげで、$blocks_tot_mil百万以上のブロックを持つ最も長いUTXOブロックチェーンです。ビットコインがその数のブロックに到達するには22世紀までかかるでしょう。

de.title: DigiFakt #1 - Wussten Sie schon...
de.content: Die DigiByte Blockchain wurde 2014 eingeführt. Dank der Blockzeit von 15 Sekunden ist sie die längste UTXO-Blockchain, die es gibt, mit über $blocks_tot_mil Millionen Blöcken. Bitcoin wird bis ins 22. Jahrhundert brauchen, um so viele Blöcke zu erreichen.

fr.title: DigiFact #1 - Saviez-vous que...
fr.content: La blockchain DigiByte a été lancée en 2014. Grâce à son temps de bloc de 15 secondes, c'est la blockchain UTXO la plus longue en existence avec plus de $blocks_tot_mil millions de blocs. Bitcoin prendra jusqu'au 22ème siècle pour atteindre autant de blocs.

pt.title: DigiFacto #1 - Você sabia...
pt.content: O blockchain DigiByte foi lançado em 2014. Graças ao seu tempo de bloco de 15 segundos, é o blockchain UTXO mais longo em existência, com mais de $blocks_tot_mil milhões de blocos. O Bitcoin levará até o século 22 para alcançar tantos blocos.

hi.title: डिजीफैक्ट #1 - क्या आप जानते थे...
hi.content: डिजीबाइट ब्लॉकचेन 2014 में शुरू किया गया था। 15 सेकंड के ब्लॉक समय के कारण, यह $blocks_tot_mil मिलियन ब्लॉकों के साथ अस्तित्व में सबसे लंबी UTXO ब्लॉकचेन है। बिटकॉइन को उतने ब्लॉकों तक पहुँचने में 22वीं सदी तक का समय लगेगा।

nl.title: DigiFeit # 1 - Wist u dat...
nl.content: De DigiByte blockchain is gelanceerd in 2014. Dankzij de bloktijd van 15 seconden is het de langste UTXO blockchain die er bestaat, met meer dan $blocks_tot_mil miljoen blokken. Bitcoin zal tot de 22e eeuw nodig hebben om dat aantal blokken te bereiken.

en.title: DigiFact # 2 - Did you know...
en.content: DigiByte has upgraded the network a number of times to include "Improvement milestones". These hard forks were not contentious splits that generated additional coins, but rather a "reorientation of the ship" that the DigiByte community was onboard with. Learn more: https://rb.gy/egrt5

zh.title: 数字事实 #2 - 你知道吗？
zh.content: DigiByte多次升级网络，包括“改进里程碑”。这些硬分叉并不是产生额外货币的有争议的分裂，而是DigiByte社区同意的“航向重新定位”。了解更多：https://rb.gy/egrt5

ru.title: ДиджиФакт #2 - Знаете ли вы...
ru.content: DigiByte несколько раз обновлял сеть, чтобы включить "Этапы улучшения". Эти хардфорки не были спорными разделениями, которые генерировали дополнительные монеты, а скорее "переориентацией корабля", с которой было согласно сообщество DigiByte. Узнайте больше: https://rb.gy/egrt5

es.title: DigiDato #2 - ¿Sabías que...
es.content: DigiByte ha actualizado la red varias veces para incluir "Hitos de mejora". Estos hard forks no fueron divisiones conflictivas que generaron monedas adicionales, sino más bien una "reorientación del barco" con la que la comunidad de DigiByte estuvo de acuerdo. Aprende más: https://rb.gy/egrt5

ko.title: 디지팩트 #2 - 혹시 알고 계셨나요...
ko.content: 디지바이트는 "개선 이정표"를 포함하도록 네트워크를 여러 번 업그레이드했습니다. 이 하드포크는 추가 코인을 생성하는 논쟁의 분열이 아니라 디지바이트 커뮤니티가 동의한 "방향 전환"이었습니다. 더 알아보기: https://rb.gy/egrt5

ja.title: デジファクト #2 - ご存知でしたか...
ja.content: DigiByteは「改善のマイルストーン」を含むようにネットワークを何度もアップグレードしてきました。これらのハードフォークは追加のコインを生み出す内容の分裂ではなく、DigiByteコミュニティが同乗した「船の方向転換」でした。もっと学ぶ: https://rb.gy/egrt5

de.title: DigiFakt #2 - Wussten Sie schon...
de.content: DigiByte hat das Netzwerk mehrmals aktualisiert, um "Verbesserungsmeilensteine" einzubeziehen. Diese Hard Forks waren keine umstrittenen Aufspaltungen, die zusätzliche Münzen generierten, sondern eine "Neuausrichtung des Schiffs", mit der die DigiByte-Gemeinschaft einverstanden war. Erfahren Sie mehr: https://rb.gy/egrt5

fr.title: DigiFact #2 - Saviez-vous que...
fr.content: DigiByte a mis à jour le réseau à plusieurs reprises pour inclure des "jalons d'amélioration". Ces fourches dures n'étaient pas des scissions contentieuses qui ont généré des pièces supplémentaires, mais plutôt une "réorientation du navire" avec laquelle la communauté DigiByte était à bord. En savoir plus : https://rb.gy/egrt5

pt.title: DigiFato #2 - Você sabia...
pt.content: DigiByte atualizou a rede várias vezes para incluir "marcos de melhorias". Esses hard forks não foram divisões contenciosas que geraram moedas adicionais, mas sim uma "reorientação do navio" com a qual a comunidade DigiByte estava a bordo. Saiba mais: https://rb.gy/egrt5

hi.title: डिजीफैक्ट #2 - क्या आप जानते थे...
hi.content: डिजीबाइट ने नेटवर्क को कई बार अपग्रेड किया है ताकि "सुधार मील के पत्थर" शामिल किए जा सकें। ये हार्ड फोर्क्स विवादास्पद विभाजन नहीं थे जो अतिरिक्त सिक्के उत्पन्न करते थे, बल्कि डिजीबाइट समुदाय द्वारा समर्थित "जहाज की पुनः ओरिएंटेशन" थे। और जानें: https://rb.gy/egrt5

nl.title: DigiFeit # 2 - Wist u dat...
nl.content: DigiByte heeft het netwerk meerdere malen geüpgraded om 'Verbeteringsmijlpalen' op te nemen. Deze hard forks waren geen controversiële splitsingen die extra munten genereerden, maar eerder een 'heroriëntatie van het schip' waarmee de DigiByte-gemeenschap aan boord was. Leer meer: https://rb.gy/egrt5

en.title: DigiFact # 3 - Did you know...
en.content: The DigiByte blockchain was fairly launched in 2014, long before the 2017 Initial Coin Offering (ICO) craze of whitepaper projects. DigiByte began with a fully working blockchain that has been improved upon consistently ever since.

zh.title: 数字事实 #3 - 你知道吗？
zh.content: DigiByte 区块链在 2014 年进行了公平启动，这比 2017 年白皮书项目的首次代币发行（ICO）热潮要早得多。DigiByte 一开始就是一个完全有效的区块链，并且自那以后一直在持续改进。

ru.title: ДиджиФакт #3 - Знаете ли вы...
ru.content: Блокчейн DigiByte был справедливо запущен в 2014 году, за долго до бума первичных предложений монет (ICO) в 2017 году. DigiByte начался с полностью рабочего блокчейна, который с тех пор постоянно улучшается.

es.title: DigiDato #3 - ¿Sabías que...
es.content: La blockchain de DigiByte se lanzó de manera justa en 2014, mucho antes de la locura de las Ofertas Iniciales de Monedas (ICO) de proyectos de libros blancos en 2017. DigiByte comenzó con una blockchain completamente funcional que se ha mejorado constantemente desde entonces.

ko.title: 디지팩트 #3 - 혹시 알고 계셨나요...
ko.content: 디지바이트 블록체인은 2014년에 공정하게 출시되었으며, 이는 2017년 백서 프로젝트의 ICO 열풍보다 훨씬 이전입니다. 디지바이트는 처음부터 완전히 작동하는 블록체인으로 시작하여 지속적으로 개선되고 있습니다.

ja.title: デジファクト #3 - ご存知でしたか...
ja.content: DigiByte ブロックチェーンは 2014 年に公正に開始され、2017 年のホワイトペーパー・プロジェクトの ICO 狂乱よりもずっと前です。DigiByte は最初から完全に機能するブロックチェーンであり、以来絶えず改善されてきました。

de.title: DigiFakt #3 - Wussten Sie schon...
de.content: Die DigiByte Blockchain wurde 2014 gerecht eingeführt, lange vor dem Hype um Initial Coin Offerings (ICO) von Whitepaper-Projekten im Jahr 2017. DigiByte begann mit einer voll funktionsfähigen Blockchain, die seitdem stetig verbessert wurde.

fr.title: DigiFact #3 - Saviez-vous que...
fr.content: La blockchain DigiByte a été lancée équitablement en 2014, bien avant la frénésie des offres initiales de pièces (ICO) de projets de livre blanc en 2017. DigiByte a commencé avec une blockchain entièrement opérationnelle qui a été constamment améliorée depuis lors.

pt.title: DigiFato #3 - Você sabia...
pt.content: A blockchain DigiByte foi lançada de forma justa em 2014, muito antes da febre de Oferta Inicial de Moedas (ICO) de projetos de whitepaper em 2017. DigiByte começou com uma blockchain totalmente funcional que tem sido constantemente aprimorada desde então.

hi.title: डिजीफैक्ट #3 - क्या आप जानते थे...
hi.content: डिजीबाइट ब्लॉकचेन की शुरुआत 2014 में न्यायपूर्ण तरीके से हुई थी, 2017 के व्हाइटपेपर प्रोजेक्ट्स के प्रारंभिक सिक्का प्रस्ताव (ICO) के क्रेज से काफी पहले। डिजीबाइट एक पूरी तरह कार्यात्मक ब्लॉकचेन के साथ शुरू हुआ था जिसे तब से लगातार सुधारा जा रहा है।

nl.title: DigiFeit #3 - Wist u dat...
nl.content: De DigiByte blockchain is eerlijk gelanceerd in 2014, lang voor de rage van Initial Coin Offerings (ICO) van whitepaper projecten in 2017. DigiByte begon met een volledig functionerende blockchain die sindsdien consequent is verbeterd.

en.title: DigiFact # 4 - Did you know...
en.content: When DigiByte launched in 2014, a tiny DigiByte pre-mine (0.5%) was given away to community members within the first 30 days, and the details can be seen on BitcoinTalk. This was done to incentivize people to download and run a full node helping to distribute the blockchain. None of the pre-mine was retained by the founder or developers.

zh.title: 数字事实 #4 - 你知道吗？
zh.content: DigiByte 在 2014 年启动时，将一小部分预挖矿的 DigiByte（0.5%）在最初的 30 天内赠送给了社区成员，详细情况可以在 BitcoinTalk 上看到。这样做是为了激励人们下载并运行一个完整的节点，帮助分发区块链。预挖矿的部分没有被创始人或开发者保留。

ru.title: ДиджиФакт #4 - Знаете ли вы...
ru.content: Когда DigiByte запустился в 2014 году, небольшое количество предварительно добытых DigiByte (0,5%) было раздано членам сообщества в течение первых 30 дней, подробности можно увидеть на BitcoinTalk. Это было сделано для стимулирования людей к загрузке и запуску полного узла, помогая распространению блокчейна. Ни один из предварительно добытых монет не был сохранен основателем или разработчиками.

es.title: DigiDato #4 - ¿Sabías que...
es.content: Cuando DigiByte se lanzó en 2014, una pequeña cantidad de DigiByte preminado (0.5%) fue entregada a miembros de la comunidad dentro de los primeros 30 días, y los detalles se pueden ver en BitcoinTalk. Esto se hizo para incentivar a las personas a descargar y ejecutar un nodo completo, ayudando a distribuir la blockchain. Ninguna de las preminas fue retenida por el fundador o los desarrolladores.

ko.title: 디지팩트 #4 - 혹시 알고 계셨나요...
ko.content: 2014년에 디지바이트가 출시될 때, 극소량의 디지바이트 프리마인(0.5%)이 최초 30일 이내에 커뮤니티 회원들에게 나눠졌으며, 세부 사항은 BitcoinTalk에서 볼 수 있습니다. 이는 사람들이 전체 노드를 다운로드하고 실행하여 블록체인을 분배하는 데 도움을 주기 위한 인센티브였습니다. 프리마인은 창립자나 개발자에게 남겨지지 않았습니다.

ja.title: デジファクト #4 - ご存知でしたか...
ja.content: DigiByteが2014年にローンチした際、わずか0.5%のプレマインDigiByteが最初の30日間でコミュニティメンバーに配られ、詳細はBitcoinTalkで確認できます。これは、人々にフルノードをダウンロードして実行し、ブロックチェーンの分散を助けるためのインセンティブでした。プレマインは創設者や開発者によって保持されていませんでした。

de.title: DigiFakt #4 - Wussten Sie schon...
de.content: Als DigiByte 2014 startete, wurde ein kleiner Anteil des DigiByte-Vorabbaus (0,5%) innerhalb der ersten 30 Tage an Gemeinschaftsmitglieder verschenkt, die Einzelheiten können auf BitcoinTalk eingesehen werden. Dies wurde getan, um Menschen dazu zu motivieren, einen vollständigen Knoten herunterzuladen und zu betreiben, um die Verteilung der Blockchain zu unterstützen. Keiner der Vorabbaus wurde vom Gründer oder den Entwicklern zurückbehalten.

fr.title: DigiFact #4 - Saviez-vous que...
fr.content: Lorsque DigiByte a été lancé en 2014, une petite quantité de pré-minage DigiByte (0,5 %) a été donnée aux membres de la communauté dans les 30 premiers jours, et les détails peuvent être consultés sur BitcoinTalk. Cela a été fait pour inciter les gens à télécharger et à exécuter un nœud complet, aidant à distribuer la blockchain. Aucun des pré-minages n'a été conservé par le fondateur ou les développeurs.

pt.title: DigiFato #4 - Você sabia...
pt.content: Quando o DigiByte foi lançado em 2014, uma pequena quantidade de pré-mineração de DigiByte (0,5%) foi distribuída aos membros da comunidade nos primeiros 30 dias, e os detalhes podem ser vistos no BitcoinTalk. Isso foi feito para incentivar as pessoas a baixar e executar um nó completo, ajudando a distribuir a blockchain. Nenhum dos pré-minados foi retido pelo fundador ou desenvolvedores.

hi.title: डिजीफैक्ट #4 - क्या आप जानते थे...
hi.content: जब DigiByte 2014 में लॉन्च हुआ था, तो बहुत कम DigiByte प्री-माइन (0.5%) को पहले 30 दिनों में समुदाय के सदस्यों को दिया गया था, और विवरण BitcoinTalk पर देखा जा सकता है। यह लोगों को प्रोत्साहित करने के लिए किया गया था कि वे पूरा नोड डाउनलोड करें और चलाएं, जिससे ब्लॉकचेन का वितरण में मदद मिले। प्री-माइन में से कोई भी हिस्सा संस्थापक या डेवलपर्स द्वारा नहीं रखा गया था।

en.title: DigiFact # 5 - Did you know...
en.content: There is no founders reward with the DigiByte blockchain. The reward for mining each block only ever goes to whoever mined it. No part of it goes to anyone else.

zh.title: 数字事实 #5 - 你知道吗？
zh.content: DigiByte 区块链没有创始人奖励。挖掘每个区块的奖励仅仅归挖掘它的人所有。没有任何部分会转给其他人。

ru.title: ДиджиФакт #5 - Знаете ли вы...
ru.content: В блокчейне DigiByte нет награды для основателей. Награда за добычу каждого блока идет только тому, кто его добыл. Никакая ее часть не идет другим лицам.

es.title: DigiDato #5 - ¿Sabías que...
es.content: No hay recompensa para los fundadores en la blockchain de DigiByte. La recompensa por minar cada bloque solo va para quien lo haya minado. Ninguna parte de ella va a ninguna otra persona.

ko.title: 디지팩트 #5 - 혹시 알고 계셨나요...
ko.content: 디지바이트 블록체인에는 창립자 보상이 없습니다. 각 블록을 채굴하는 데 대한 보상은 오직 그 블록을 채굴한 사람에게만 갑니다. 그것의 어떤 부분도 다른 사람에게 가지 않습니다.

ja.title: デジファクト #5 - ご存知でしたか...
ja.content: DigiByte ブロックチェーンには創設者報酬はありません。ブロックのマイニングに対する報酬は、そのブロックをマイニングした人にのみ行きます。その一部が他の人に行くことはありません。

de.title: DigiFakt #5 - Wussten Sie schon...
de.content: Bei der DigiByte Blockchain gibt es keine Gründerbelohnung. Die Belohnung für das Mining eines Blocks geht immer nur an denjenigen, der ihn gemined hat. Kein Teil davon geht an andere.

fr.title: DigiFact #5 - Saviez-vous que...
fr.content: Il n'y a pas de récompense pour les fondateurs avec la blockchain DigiByte. La récompense pour le minage de chaque bloc ne va qu'à celui qui l'a miné. Aucune part ne va à quelqu'un d'autre.

pt.title: DigiFato #5 - Você sabia...
pt.content: Não há recompensa para os fundadores no blockchain DigiByte. A recompensa por minerar cada bloco sempre vai para quem o minerou. Nenhuma parte dela vai para outra pessoa.

hi.title: डिजीफैक्ट #5 - क्या आप जानते थे...
hi.content: डिजीबाइट ब्लॉकचेन में कोई संस्थापक पुरस्कार नहीं है। प्रत्येक ब्लॉक की खनन के लिए पुरस्कार केवल उसी को मिलता है जिसने इसे खनन किया है। इसका कोई भी हिस्सा किसी और को नहीं जाता है।

nl.title: DigiFeit #5 - Wist u dat...
nl.content: Er is geen oprichtersbeloning bij de DigiByte blockchain. De beloning voor het mijnen van elk blok gaat alleen naar degene die het gemijnd heeft. Niemand anders krijgt daar een deel van.

digifact6.title: DigiFact # 6 - Did you know...
digifact6.content: The DigiByte founder and developers have either purchased their DGB coins on an exchange at market rates, or mined them, just like everybody else. There was no ICO (Initial Coin Offering) for the DigiByte blockchain. Every coin has been fairly mined since the genesis block.

digifact7.title: DigiFact # 7 - Did you know...
digifact7.content: Transaction fees on the DigiByte blockchain are typically incredibly low. In Block 7658349, a user sent 342,000,000 DGB (worth $6 million USD at the time) from the inputs of over 200 different addresses. It cost 1/10th of a cent (USD) in fees and took only a minute or two to confirm.

digifact8.title: DigiFact # 8 - Did you know...
digifact8.content: DigiByte pioneered the DigiShield difficulty adjustment. It's used in Dogecoin, Ubiq, ZCash, Monacoin and parts of the code are even used in Ethereum. What is DigiShield (a.k.a MultiShield)? Learn more here: https://j.mp/3oivy5u

digifact9.title: DigiFact # 9 - Did you know...
digifact9.content: DigiByte was the first non-Bitcoin blockchain to fix the major inflation bug in 2018. Rapid response from our rock-star developers!

digifact10.title: DigiFact # 10 - Did you know...
digifact10.content: The DigiByte "Genesis Block" contained the following headline: "USA Today: 10/Jan/2014, Target: Data stolen from up to 110M customers." This forever cemented DigiByte's focus on cybersecurity.

digifact11.title: DigiFact # 11 - Did you know...
digifact11.content: DigiByte was the first coin to upgrade from a single mining algorithm to MultiAlgo, for the additional security provided by having 5x algorithms. This upgrade occurred in late 2014 as the "MultiAlgo" network upgrade. What's MultiAlgo? Learn more here: https://j.mp/3oivy5u

digifact12.title: DigiFact # 12 - Did you know...
digifact12.content: Initially DigiByte only used the Scrypt algorithm for mining. In September 2014, the network upgraded to MultiAlgo, utilizing Scrypt, SHA256, Skein, Qubit & Myriad-Groestl. This massively improved decentralization by enabling a broader variety of mining hardware to be used.

digifact13.title: DigiFact # 13 - Did you know...
digifact13.content: In 2019, DigiByte upgraded the network, replacing the Myriad-Groestl algorithm with Odocrypt, an algorithm designed to be ASIC-resistant by targeting mining with FPGA hardware. However, with most ASIC-resistant algorithms, if the financial incentives are there, eventually ASICs will be developed for these algorithms, as is the case with Odocrypt.

digifact14.title: DigiFact # 14 - Did you know...
digifact14.content: In 2018, the DigiByte community raised enough funds to supply Venezuelan refugees crossing the border with over a thousand bottles of water, feed 160 orphaned children for a month, provide essential maintenance for a hospital, refurbish an Adicora school kitchen, and hosting several free community lunches for hundreds of people.

digifact15.title: DigiFact # 15 - Did you know...
digifact15.content: DigiByte is not an ICO or a token launched on another network, but rather a pure blockchain project with it's own consensus rules such as Bitcoin or Vertcoin.

digifact16.title: DigiFact # 16 - Did you know...
digifact16.content: For general DigiByte support, a good place to start is with the community support tool available here: https://dgbsupport.digiassetx.com/

digifact17.title: DigiFact # 17 - Did you know...
digifact17.content: DigiByte can be used to store tiny amounts (80-bytes) of data along with a transaction known as OP_RETURN. This is useful for document hashes for notarization / validation, dApps, scripting and more.

digifact18.title: DigiFact # 18 - Did you know...
digifact18.content: You can look up any transaction on the DigiByte Blockchain by inputting a transaction ID, DigiByte address, or block number into a "Blockchain Explorer". The community maintains one such explorer you can use at: https://digiexplorer.info.

digifact19.title: DigiFact # 19 - Did you know...
digifact19.content: Have you wanted to run your own DigiExplorer? Or get other data out of the blockchain so you can integrate it with your business? There are handy guides that will help you here: https://dgbwiki.com

digifact20.title: DigiFact # 20 - Did you know...
digifact20.content: The name "DigiByte" was originally chosen as it signifies a "Digital Byte" of data. This is because blockchain technology such as DigiByte can be used for so much more than as a "coin" such as silver or gold. DigiByte is incredibly multi-purpose.

digifact21.title: DigiFact # 21 - Did you know...
digifact21.content: A copy of the DigiByte blockchain open source code v7.17.3 is laying in cold storage 250 meters deep in the permafrost of an Arctic mountain! Thanks to the GitHub Arctic Code Vault program!

digifact22.title: DigiFact # 22 - Did you know...
digifact22.content: DigiByte is available on 100+ exchanges, including many different fiat pairings with local currencies, making it easier than ever to buy DigiByte.

digifact23.title: DigiFact # 23 - Did you know...
digifact23.content: DigiByte was founded by Jared Tate in 2013 and the Genesis block was mined on 10th January 2014. While Jared remains an active member of the DigiByte community, and is one of the Core developers, he does not dictate the direction of the project. DigiByte has no boss - it is entirely run and managed by a global community of dedicated volunteers.

digifact24.title: DigiFact # 24 - Did you know...
digifact24.content: DigiByte can do smart-contracts thanks to its "script" language. You can run a whole lot of powerful tools on top of DigiByte to power a dApp.

digifact25.title: DigiFact # 25 - Did you know...
digifact25.content: The official DigiByte Core wallet is available for Windows, MacOS and Linux as well a low powered single-board computers such as the Raspberry Pi. DigiByte is supported on mobile by a number of third party wallets, such as Coinomi and Securus. It is also available on many hardware wallets, like Ledger and Trezor. Be advised that not all of these wallet also support Digi-ID and DigiAssets.

digifact26.title: DigiFact # 26 - Did you know...
digifact26.content: Digi-ID by DigiByte is one of the simplest yet most secure authentication methods in the world. Even Google warns against using their own time-based 2FA codes or SMS-2FA, but Digi-ID overcomes all the shortcomings. Digi-ID is open source, free, ad-free (forever), private & secure. To learn more visit: https://www.digi-id.io/

digifact27.title: DigiFact # 27 - Did you know...
digifact27.content: The development of DigiByte is done by a worldwide team of volunteers, who all donate their time out of a passion for the project. There is no central company employing and paying people, it's all given freely by our incredible developers and supporting community.

digifact28.title: DigiFact # 28 - Did you know...
digifact28.content: The last DigiByte will be mined by the year 2035. There is less than half of all remaining $DGB waiting to be mined by anybody in the world. These are not "owned" by anybody, unlike an ICO and will be newly "minted".

digifact29.title: DigiFact # 29 - Did you know...
digifact29.content: DigiByte can be used for Atomic Swaps with other blockchains safely and securely since the implementation of SegWit in early 2017. There is no need for a second layer network to perform this and it can instead be done directly.

digifact30.title: DigiFact # 30 - Did you know...
digifact30.content: When all DigiByte have been mined, the network will continue to function with the miners mining / securing the network as they do at present. They will only get the transaction fees from sending $DGB.

digifact31.title: DigiFact # 31 - Did you know...
digifact31.content: If you ever have issues with getting your DigiByte out of a wallet, you can sweep the funds to a new wallet using the DigiSweep tool created by Matthew Cornelisse of DigiAssetX. It's easy to use & open-source. Find it here: https://digisweep.digiassetx.com/:

digifact32.title: DigiFact # 32 - Did you know...
digifact32.content: When DigiByte launched, there was a count-down to the release of the code, and to the first block being mined. This was one of the things done to encourage a "fair" distribution, right from the very beginning in 2014.

digifact33.title: DigiFact # 33 - Did you know...
digifact33.content: DigiByte was originally based on a fork of the Litecoin code-base (Though, a 100% independent blockchain with unique Genesis Block). DigiByte has since maintained closer features with Bitcoin, while also significantly innovating and surpassing it! View the code at: https://github.com/digibyte-core/digibyte/

digifact34.title: DigiFact # 34 - Did you know...
digifact34.content: Anyone can build second-layer networks on top of the DigiByte Blockchain, such as DigiAssets, Lightning Networks, ICOs, Tokens, assets and more.

digifact35.title: DigiFact # 35 - Did you know...
digifact35.content: There's a mind boggling number of possible DigiByte addresses. 1,461,501,637,330,902,918,203,684,832,716,283,019,655,932,542,976 (2¹⁶⁰). This is a quindecillion. It's so big you could randomly generate trillions a second & never generate the same as somebody else.

digifact36.title: DigiFact # 36 - Did you know...
digifact36.content: You can accept DigiByte in retail scenarios just by entering the desired amount in to your wallet. The QR code will automatically include your address and amount when the sender scans it. Super simple, straight from your wallet.

digifact37.title: DigiFact # 37 - Did you know...
digifact37.content: The DigiByte Core wallet connects to a variety of peers, not just the 'closest' or 'fastest'. It finds connections from all over the world, to ensure you get a broad consensus on the DigiByte blockchain and protects you against sybil attacks.

digifact38.title: DigiFact # 38 - Did you know...
digifact38.content: DigiByte implemented the DigiSpeed protocol in 2015. This allowed DigiByte to decrease from 30 second to 15 second block timings. Lightning fast!

digifact39.title: DigiFact # 39 - Did you know...
digifact39.content: DigiByte Critical Infrastructure Team (DGBCIT) was founded in Jan 2023. with the goal of ensuring that the DigiByte blockchain, along with its critical services, are kept running at all times. This is achieved though a community effort of coordinated decentralization and redundancy. Please join us in the #DGBCIT channel on DigiByte Discord server: https://t.ly/DGBCIT

digifact40.title: DigiFact # 40 - Did you know...
digifact40.content: Did you know that DigiByte is permissionless? This means there is no individual or company to ask if you can build a dApp on top of it, use it, send it, receive it, accept it for your business, advertise it, promote it. You simply "can"!

digifact41.title: DigiFact # 41 - Did you know...
digifact41.content: DigiByte is now working on its 8th "protocol" version in 6 years since creation. This is what the first number in the DigiByte Core Wallet version means, the protocol version. DigiByte has consistently grown and improved throughout its history, and continues to do-so.

digifact42.title: DigiFact # 42 - Did you know...
digifact42.content: DigiBytes MultiAlgo means 5x algorithms all continuously compete for every single block. Others such as X16R are very different, instead rotating through each sub-algorithm with all miners swapping and using that same. As such, X16R is still a "single algorithm" compared with DigiBytes 5x MultiAlgo implementation.

digifact43.title: DigiFact # 43 - Did you know...
digifact43.content: The Dandelion privacy protocol was implemented in 2019, to help protect your privacy, by masking the originating IP address. To learn more about Dandelion, visit: https://j.mp/3Hag6AX

digifact44.title: DigiFact # 44 - Did you know...
digifact44.content: MultiShield is a powerful difficulty adjustment algorithm. It ensures each of DigiBytes 5X algorithms all mine roughly an equal amount of blocks, while maintaining a steady 15 second timing. What is MultiShield? Learn more here: https://j.mp/3oivy5u

digifact45.title: DigiFact # 45 - Did you know...
digifact45.content: Because of MultiShield, DigiByte has some of the most accurate and stable block-timings. Where other projects usually wait for 3-4 days to adjust, MultiShield tweaks. adjusts & refines every single block. Learn more here: https://j.mp/3oivy5u

digifact46.title: DigiFact # 46 - Did you know...
digifact46.content: DigiByte was the first major blockchain project to enable the Dandelion privacy protocol, to protect your IP address. You can opt out of the privacy-protection it offers if you want even faster transactions. To learn more about Dandelion, visit: https://j.mp/3Hag6AX

digifact47.title: DigiFact # 47 - Did you know...
digifact47.content: DigiByte is all about choice, and what works for you personally. DigiByte is available on over two dozen wallets, so there's something that will fit everyone's requirements.

digifact48.title: DigiFact # 48 - Did you know...
digifact48.content: DigiByte originally had 60 second block timings, however through multiple network upgrades that were improved upon, first to 30, and now to the 15 seconds it is today.

digifact49.title: DigiFact # 49 - Did you know...
digifact49.content: DigiByte has had 100% uptime since its launch. While some people restart their computers from time to time, hundreds of others remain online all the time so that even in event of a major nationwide internet outage, DigiByte would still continue to function.

digifact50.title: DigiFact # 50 - Did you know...
digifact50.content: The DigiByte Faucet by Renzo Diaz gives you an easy way to get some free DGB. It's a great way for DigiByte newcomers to experience this amazing technology first hand. For developers, there is also a testnet faucet. Find it here: https://www.digifaucet.org/

digifact51.title: DigiFact # 51 - Did you know...
digifact51.content: Anybody is able to contribute to the DigiByte code and make improvements. All submissions get reviewed by other developers to ensure no malicious code is accidentally accepted. Join the Gitter developer chat here: https://gitter.im/DigiByte-Core/protocol

digifact52.title: DigiFact # 52 - Did you know...
digifact52.content: Have you ever wanted to see some statistics about the DigiByte network? For an overview of the of the DigiByte network, visit: https://digistats.digibyteservers.io

digifact53.title: DigiFact # 53 - Did you know...
digifact53.content: Nobody knows exactly how many "nodes" there are on the DigiByte network, because there is no central point that all computers check in with. This ensures your privacy when you download the wallet software.

digifact54.title: DigiFact # 54 - Did you know...
digifact54.content: DigiByte has never hand a contentious hard fork despite ongoing major code changes. Mining is so decentralized that when the myriad-groestl algorithm was replaced with odocrypt, MG mining pools installed the upgrade even when it meant they would no longer be able to mine.

digifact55.title: DigiFact # 55 - Did you know...
digifact55.content: DigiByte mining is some of the most distributed in the industry. When a 7-day period in September 2019 was compared against Bitcoin and Litecoin, DigiByte had over 10X the number of unique miners. This grew to over 20X the unique miners when looking at a 3-month period. View more stats here: https://j.mp/3ojzV08

digifact56.title: DigiFact # 56 - Did you know...
digifact56.content: If the biggest 5x pools from Bitcoin were to collude, they could control the Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Bitcoin SV networks permanently until others grew to have more hash-power than them. Those same pools would not be a threat to DigiByte thanks to DigiBytes MultiAlgo and MultiShield aspects.

digifact57.title: DigiFact # 57 - Did you know...
digifact57.content: Every month, the DigiByte that miners get as a block-reward is decreased by 1%. This gives DigiByte a very smooth supply-curve for new DigiByte, rather than a "halving" event every few years.

digifact58.title: DigiFact # 58 - Did you know...
digifact58.content: Transactions on the DigiByte network are public, but pseudo-anonymous. You can see them on a Blockchain explorer, however there is nothing inherently that can link a new transaction / address to an end-user. There are no usernames, email addresses etc required to use the DigiByte network.

digifact59.title: DigiFact # 59 - Did you know...
digifact59.content: DigiByte addresses can be re-used, but it's completely optional. The best practice is for a wallet to give you a new address each time after your previous address has received a transaction.

digifact60.title: DigiFact # 60 - Did you know...
digifact60.content: The source code for the DigiByte blockchain is completely open-source, anybody can see it, inspect it, and review it. The Core Wallet is available at: https://github.com/DigiByte-Core/DigiByte

digifact61.title: DigiFact # 61 - Did you know...
digifact61.content: DigiByte blocks have an expected 15 second time, which means every single day there are 5,760 new blocks added to the DigiByte blockchain.

digifact62.title: DigiFact # 62 - Did you know...
digifact62.content: A single DigiByte can be divided up to 8 decimal places. That's 1/100,000,000 of a DigiByte. This is known as a Digit or DIT for short. (e.g. 1000 DITS)

digifact63.title: DigiFact # 63 - Did you know...
digifact63.content: Each of the 5x algorithms that DigiByte uses to secure the network and mine new blocks has an equal 20% chance to find every single block. There is no priority given to one or another.

digifact64.title: DigiFact # 64 - Did you know...
digifact64.content: DigiByte has 3x address types, each starting with a different prefix. Modern addresses start with the letters "dgb1" for Bech32 formatted addresses or the letter "S" for SegWit (Segregated Witness). Legacy addresses start with the letter "D". While support for these will remain, they are gradually being phased out in favor of of Bech32 addresses.

digifact65.title: DigiFact # 65 - Did you know...
digifact65.content: DigiByte addresses starting with "dgb1" (known as Bech32 format) have multiple advantages, such as error correction in the event they were incorrectly written-down, as well as being much easier for both humans and computers to recognise that they are DigiByte-specific addresses.

digifact66.title: DigiFact # 66 - Did you know...
digifact66.content: For a protocol upgrade to take place, over 70% of the network must agree and be in consensus that the upgrade will take place. This occurs by "signalling" support for it when blocks are mined, over the course of a 1-week period.

digifact67.title: DigiFact # 67 - Did you know...
digifact67.content: There is a maximum of 21 billion DigiByte that will ever exist. This was intentionally chosen as a 1000:1 ratio compared to Bitcoins 21 million. No more can ever be created.

digifact68.title: DigiFact # 68 - Did you know...
digifact68.content: DigiByte is available on thousands of Crypto ATMs around the world! This is a great way for people new to cryptocurrency to get involved through a more "traditional" method of currency exchange.

digifact69.title: DigiFact # 69 - Did you know...
digifact69.content: DigiByte can be used to verify and validate documents, music, media, identity and more! Although DigiByte excels as a means of exchanging value, it is not limited to just being a currency.

digifact70.title: DigiFact # 70 - Did you know...
digifact70.content: You can use multiple wallets! DigiByte is not just limited to a single piece of software, and the community is encouraged to find an app that works best for them, so try one, try a few, and keep using the ones you like the most.

digifact71.title: DigiFact # 71 - Did you know...
digifact71.content: DigiByte cannot ever have a centralized "burning" of the maximum supply as other ICO's or centrally controlled tokens can. Because DigiByte is a fully decentralized proejct, it's impossible to issue a large scale "burning" of unused DigiByte. At most, you could only ever destroy your own if you willingly transferred them in to the void.

digifact72.title: DigiFact # 72 - Did you know...
digifact72.content: Transactions on the DigiByte blockchain cannot be undone, by anybody. Once a transaction has been made, it is permanent. Did you accidentally send 50 DigiByte instead of 5 DigiByte? You'll need to ask the recipient to return the surplus, as there is no "Undo" function, and no central banking authority who can roll back transactions.

digifact73.title: DigiFact # 73 - Did you know...
digifact73.content: Do you want to start a DigiByte podcast, or meet-up? Go for it! There is nobody to ask for permission, part of DigiByte being a "permissionless" project. It is implied that you can, so go right ahead and do it.

digifact74.title: DigiFact # 74 - Did you know...
digifact74.content: If you have ever had the misfortune to accidentally send your DigiByte to a Dogecoin address, your coins may not be lost. DigiSweep by DigiByte community member Matthew Cornellisse (@mctrivia) may be able to help you recover them. Find it here: https://digisweep.digiassetx.com/

digifact75.title: DigiFact # 75 - Did you know...
digifact75.content: The DigiByte Alliance is a public non-profit foundation founded in Wyoming in March 2021. Its mission is to to accelerate the growth and adoption of DigiByte. Learn more: https://www.dgballiance.org/

digifact76.title: DigiFact # 76 - Did you know...
digifact76.content: The DigiByte subreddit located at r/DigiByte has over 40,000 members. It's a great place to stay updated about all the news and developments in the DigiByte community. Join here: https://reddit.com/r/Digibyte

digifact77.title: DigiFact # 77 - Did you know...
digifact77.content: The DigiByte Discord server is where you will find the most active members of the DigiByte community, and is great way to connect with all the people working on DigiByte behind the scenes. Please join us! https://dsc.gg/digibytediscord

digifact78.title: DigiFact # 78 - Did you know...
digifact78.content: DigiNode Tools is a software suite that makes it easy to setup and manage a DigiByte and/or DigiAsset Node on low power device like a Raspberry Pi or Ubuntu system. Setup is menu-driven and there are detailed step-by-step instructions provided. You can even setup a Dual Node to run both a mainnet and testnet node on the same device. Learn more here: https://diginode.tools/

digifact79.title: DigiFact # 79 - Did you know...
digifact79.content: To view all the existing nodes on the DigiByte network, you can use the website https://digibyteseed.com created by DigiByte community member Jan de Jong. It displays the DigiByte Seeders and all the current mainnet and testnet nodes on the DigiByte network. It's also a great way to check on the status of your own DigiByte node.

digifact80.title: DigiFact # 80 - Did you know...
digifact80.content: A "DigiByte Seeder" is a lightweight DNS server run by a few trusted volunteers from the DigiByte community. It continuously crawls the DigiByte network looking for nodes and maintains a list of the IP addressess and ports of the most reliable ones. DigiByte Nodes joining the network use the DigiByte Seeders to find other nodes to connect to. Learn more here: https://github.com/DigiByte-Core/digibyte-seeder

digifact81.title: DigiFact # 81 - Did you know...
digifact81.content: The website "DigiByte Facts" is a fantastic learning resource created by a member of the DigiByte community. It offers many of these DigiFacts as shareable images, along with quizzes and other resources to help you learn more about DigiByte. Find it here: https://digifacts.org/

digifact82.title: DigiFact # 82 - Did you know...
digifact82.content: The DigiByte Wiki is a fantastic resource of information on all things DigiByte, written and maintained by members of the DigiByte community: https://dgbwiki.com/

digifact83.title: DigiFact # 83 - Did you know...
digifact83.content: DigiByte Domains is a service created by DigiByte community memebr Renzo Dias. A DigiByte domain is a name that references an DigiByte wallet address. It's powered by DigiAssets and the domain is the asset. For example, you can send some DigiByte or DigiAssets to 'domain.dgb' and it will arrive to the address that holds the domain. You can purchase your own DigiByte domain here: https://digibytedomains.com/

digifact84.title: DigiFact # 84 - Did you know...
digifact84.content: For developers, DigiByte JS is a pure and powerful Javascript DigiByte library forked from Bitpay's Bitcore Lib library. Find it here: https://github.com/RenzoDD/digibyte-js

digifact85.title: DigiFact # 85 - Did you know...
digifact85.content: DigiAssets are a secure, scalable second-layer built on top of the DigiByte Blockchain that allows for the decentralized issuance of digital assets (NFTs), tokens, smart contracts, digital identity and more.

digifact86.title: DigiFact # 86 - Did you know...
digifact86.content: DigiAsset Core, currently under active development, is the most recent implementation of the DigiAsset protocol. Spearheaded by community member Matthew Cornelisse, it runs alongside a DigiByte Core node and helps decentralize DigiAssets and their metadata. It is important to stress the DigiAsset Core is not part of DigiByte Core - it is an independent but complementary community-driven project. Find it here: https://github.com/DigiAsset-Core/DigiAsset_Core

digifact87.title: DigiFact # 87 - Did you know...
digifact87.content: The DigiAsset Explorer, created by DigiByte community member Renzo Diaz, makes it easy to lookup information about DigiAsset transactions. Find it here: https://digiassets.info/
